cells.data:
Partition of a set $S$ is a collection $\{ A_i \mid i \in I \}$ of non-empty disjoint subsets $A_i$ of $S$
$A_i \neq \emptyset$
$i \neq j \implies A_i \cap A_j \neq \emptyset$

Equivalence relations give a partition
The sets in the parition are the equivalence classes

Relation $a - b \in \mathbb{Z}$ is an equivalence relation on $\mathbb{R}$ that partitions it into $\{ A_x \mid x \in [0,1) \}, A_x = [x] = \{ y \mid y = x + m, m \in \mathbb{Z} \}$

A partition of $S = \{ 1,2,3 \dots, 10 \}$ is given by $P = \{\{1,2,7\}, \{3,5,8,10\}, \{4\}, \{6,8\}\}$
We can define the relation $R$ given by $a \sim_R b$ if $a,b$ are in the same $A_i$ for some $i$
Can easily prove this is an equivalence relation

Let $f : A \to B$ be a function
The graph of $f$ is a relation from $A \to B$

Counting

Fundamental principle (multiplication)
